page.title: 14RELIGION. S CREAKE
page.content: The only surviving church in the village is the Church of England's St Mary's. The Congregational Church, and the Primitive Methodist Chapel have closed. Roman Catholic and Methodist services are held in Fakenham and Burnham Market. Recent Church of England policy of allocating its total available clergy on a Diocesan bases, has meant that the number of priests in Norfolk is much less than the number of parishes. The Vica of S Creake is also the Priest-in-charge of five other parishes. This presents him with many problems. Apart from travelling over many miles, over minor roads, in winter, he has to adapt to variations in the order of service, from one parish to the next. For example; S Creake has a high church service and N Creake a low one.
